comment.author: 99606883@N00
comment._content: Awesome shot of the old bridge.. This is where I used to go fishing a lot when I was younger.. The current bridge is much bigger and stronger.. The current bridge stands around 30-50 feet off the water and me and my friends used to cliff dive off the center point when we were young and stupid. Diving into the water at those heights was dangerous because of the speed you hit the water. Every time I dove off the center point head first it felt like someone hit me over the head with a 2x4. Another dangerous part of diving off this bridge is the threat of hitting a boat coming through the cut and once you hit the water you must swim as fast as possible to the side or you will be swept out to the ocean from the strong rip tides common at the inlet. Haulover Beach just to the north of this bridge is Florida's only nude beach. Here is the birds eye view of the bridge! Also see this site for more Historical info on this area. haulover.us/
